answers.answer: If you don't have a big appetite I would have 6 small meals a day. Yogurt fruit greens protein. Maybe stay away from away alot of sugary things since you said you were overweight so try to prevent gestational diabetes. Lots of water away lot and take your prenatals to supplement what you sent take in. Congratulations!

What to expect when you're expecting (you can find the book second hand for so cheap) has a pregnancy diet in it. It's hard to stick exactly to it, but it is great as an outline! I would recommend it.

question: I just found out that I'm pregnant on Tuesday and apparently I'm 4 weeks along. I haven't had the morning sickness or Breast tenderness or any other real symptoms of pregnancy other than fatigue. I don't have much of an appetite but this is kind of normal since I've been working from home for the past few months and I haven't been very active. I want to make sure that I'm eating healthy and enough food even though I'm not feeling hungry. I know I'm overweight 5'5 187 lbs so I want to be as healthy as possible now that I know I'm having a baby. Any tips on what kind of eating habits I should be practicing now?
title: How should I be eating?
